A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm not here to belittle or insult fellow SW fans because they have the "wrong" opinion. 
There is no "right" or "wrong" opinion\, as truth lies in the eye of the beholder.

Oh\, I'm also not a bot configured to bring the audience score down\, unlike all the bots hard at work posting nonsense one-liners accompanied with 5 stars in order to keep the score above 50% ;)

That said\, it is my humble opinion that TLJ was enjoyable with respect to the visual spectacle and the film score by John Williams.

However\, everything else I hated\, especially:
- the storytelling or should I say\, the string of major plot holes\,
- the unbelievable character development\, the lack of character development or the one-dimensional portraying of character\, and Ma-REY *bleep*ing SUE!
- the relentless attempts at comical relief which failed every single time\,
- the obsession by the producers/writer/director to shove real world problems and their very strong opinions about them into a science fiction movie\, which is supposed to be all about escaping the real world for its duration\, and not a political pamphlet.
- the overdose of fluffy cute aliens which are only in there so kids can start begging their parents to buy all the stuff as soon as they come out of the theaters\, 
- and last but not least\, the blatant disrespect to beloved SW characters\, yes\, I'm talking about superman Leia (RIP Carrie) and the character murder of Luke Skywalker in particular. I can feel your pain\, Mark...

Empress Kathleen has ordered Darth Rian to brutally rape and murder Star Wars and throw its corpse in a ditch and that is exactly what happened...
